page.title: 03LAW AND ORDER
page.content: The Dunfermline Police Force, which now employs 650 men, has to deal with approximately four arrests per day. This number increased during the year long miners' strike. Nowadays the Dunfermline Police find that younger people commit more crimes than older people. Few murders are committed in the Dunfermline area, but Police find that drugs are an increasing problem. There are four inspectors and nine sergeants at Dunfermline Police Station. Eleven traffic wardens assist the police. There are 17 cells at the new police station: 14 for men and 3 for women. A Sheriff Court has recently been built beside the police station.
